perturbation.original_text: "Lead-time" is defined as the amount of time between Manufacturer receiving an order and EMV receipt of the goods ordered. The ordering processes are listed in Section 4.
perturbation.changed_text: "Lead-time" refers to the period of time it takes for the manufacturer to fulfill an order.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text removes the reference to Section 4 where the ordering process is detailed. If Section 4 is relied upon elsewhere in the contract, the lack of reference here creates uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: The Manufacturer shall have the right to make modifications to Product pricing during a given year when the prices of raw materials, within the order cycle, experience massive variations in prices (massive variations in prices refer to the monthly average price changes of five main raw materials: steel, aluminum, copper, composite materials, engineering plastics exceed 5% from window query of Chinese futures trading), upon providing EMV with not less than sixty (60) days' notice of such price change, provided that no such price changes will apply to any Purchase Order already submitted by EMV at such time, or within such sixty (60) day period.
perturbation.changed_text: The Manufacturer shall have the right to make modifications to Product pricing during a given year, upon providing EMV with reasonable notice of such price change.
perturbation.explanation: The amended text removes the definition of 'massive variations in prices' and eliminates the objective criteria for price adjustments. This creates uncertainty, as the term 'reasonable notice' is not defined, potentially leading to disputes over whether EMV was given adequate notice and whether the manufacturer's actions align with the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: EMV may terminate this Agreement in the event the Manufacturer fails to achieve satisfactory assessments in two consecutive assessments conducted in accordance with section 4.3 and the Manufacturer has failed to take corrective action to substantially meet the performance targets agreed by EMV and the Manufacturer within180 days of the second assessment.
perturbation.changed_text: EMV may terminate this Agreement in the event the Manufacturer fails to achieve satisfactory assessments.
perturbation.explanation: The amended text removes the reference to section 4.3 where the assessments is detailed and the 180 days timeline. This creates uncertainty, as there are no clear instructions when EMV can terminate the contract.
